name: Jubilant Tribble Component Library
description: A collection of reusable HTML components for the CMS environment.

usage_rules.structure: Do not modify the class names or HTML structure of components.
usage_rules.content: Inner text, image src, and link href attributes are placeholders.

environment_dependencies.description: All components are designed to work within this specific technical environment. The custom_css file contains many important, pre-built styles that should be leveraged.

components.name: FAQ Accordion
components.description: A responsive and accessible accordion section for displaying a list of frequently asked questions.

components.name: Page Template: Hero + Sticky Nav (The Shell)
components.description: The main page template for building new content pages. It includes the hero, sticky navigation, breadcrumbs, and author meta-data. IMPORTANTLY, it also contains the necessary CSS to render the 'Pillar Page Snippets' correctly.

placeholders.name: BREADCRUMB_HTML
placeholders.description: Replace the inner HTML of the `<ul class='breadcrumb'>` with the correct `<li>` elements for the new page's hierarchy.

placeholders.name: AUTHOR_NAME
placeholders.description: Update the text of the author's name in the author-meta-data section.

placeholders.name: PUBLISH_DATE
placeholders.description: Update the text of the publish date.

placeholders.name: LAST_UPDATED_DATE
placeholders.description: Update the text of the last updated date.

placeholders.name: HERO_TITLE
placeholders.description: Update the text inside the `<h1>` tag in the hero section.

placeholders.description:

placeholders.name: INTERNAL_NAV_LINKS_HTML
placeholders.description: Replace the inner HTML of the `<ul class='nav'>` in the sticky navigation with the correct links for the page's content sections.

components.name: Pillar Page Content Snippet Collection
components.description: This is NOT a single component. It is a library of reusable HTML blocks (like comparison tables, feature cards, CTAs). These snippets are designed to be placed inside the 'Page Template: Hero + Sticky Nav'.
